title: Child rapist sentenced to at least 25 years in a South African gang-run prison
text:
A paedophile who raped a seven-year-old girl in a Pretoria restaurant toilet while she cried out for her mother has been sentenced to life in prison.

Nicholas Ninow, 21, was sentenced to at least 25 years in the Kgosi Mampuru Prison yesterday for snatching a seven-year-old girl from the woman's toilet at a Dros restaurant and brutally raping her.

The mother told the court that she could hear her child shouting 'please help me' as Ninow assaulted her.

'And as we pushed harder, the person inside said ‘what do you want? You are disturbing me,' she added.

Convicted child rapist Nicholas Ninow stands in the dock and listen to his sentencing. He received at least 25 years in prison

The Kgosi Mampuru II prison has a terrifying history as the location for being the main site for hangings during the apartheid era. Prisoners are said to be kept 'on a tight leash' and gangs run the facility

Convicted rapist, Nicholas Ninow, can be seen testifies during mitigation of sentence. Ninow was found guilty of raping a seven-year-old girl at the Dros restaurant's bathroom in Silverton, possession of illegal substance and defeating the ends of justice

The girl's mother, along with other restaurant staff, were trying to get through the door but Ninow was holding it closed.

When they breached the door, another witness said the man was completely naked as was the girl.

It is reported that Ninow had been seen watching the girl as she played in the children's play area before he stalked her into the woman's bathroom.

A mob soon gathered and tried to attack Ninow and restaurant staff had to lock him in the bathroom until the police arrived.

Building of the Kgosi Mampuru II prison in central Pretoria. Ninow was found to be fit to stand trial although he had a history of mental health disorders, including bipolar and depression. Witnesses said that he was 'clearly drunk and high' during the vicious attack

The man and his victim were found in the bathroom at this restaurant in Pretoria, South Africa, with the young girl bleeding from the groin

The 20-year-old man had reportedly been 'stalking' his seven-year-old victim as she was in the restaurant's play area

During the trial, which began last Wednesday, the rapist tried to plead diminished reponsibility due to being under the influence of drugs and alcohol.

His defence team also argued that he had a history of mental health issues, including bipolar disorder and depression, and that this affected his decision making on the day of the crime.

Witnesses also said that he was 'clearly high and drunk.'

A full psychiatric assessment found him fit to stand trial.

'At the time of the alleged offence, the accused did not suffer from a mental illness or intellectual disability that affected his ability to distinguish between the rightful and wrongful nature of his deeds,' the psychiatric report read.

The Kgosi Mampuru II prison has a terrifying history as the location for being the main site for hangings during the apartheid era.

Prisoners are said to be 'kept on a tight leash,' according to the Sun and they reported that gangs will rape disobedient inmates and infect them with HIV.
description: A convicted paedophile (pictured left) who raped a girl, 7, in a Pretoria restaurant toilet while she cried out for her mother has been sentenced to life in an infamous South African prison.
